title: Wildcard Pattern Matching
statement: Given a string S and a pattern P, implement wildcard pattern matching with support for '?' and '*'. '?' matches any single character, '*' matches any sequence of characters (including empty).
input_format:
First line contains string S.
Second line contains pattern P.
output_format: Print 'YES' if the pattern matches the entire string, otherwise 'NO'.
constraints:
0 <= |S| <= 2000
0 <= |P| <= 2000
S contains only lowercase English letters.
P contains lowercase English letters, '?' and '*'.
